com.viaoa.jfc

Class OASplitButton

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.AbstractButton
            • javax.swing.JButton
              • com.viaoa.jfc.OASplitButton
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.ItemSelectable, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.SwingConstants
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    OAColorSplitButton, OAMultiButtonSplitButton

    public class OASplitButton
extends javax.swing.JButton
    Creates a single JButton that internally has two buttons: a main button, and a button with a down arrow. The SplitButton will manage the settings and events for mainButton, and the application will need to create an actionListener to the dropDownButton. This is a subclass of JButton, since toolbars have methods that work with buttons. ex: toolbar.setRollOver()
    Author:
    vvia
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
